p.s: subject: The Hate U Give should not be banned
I am and I live in Germany.
I know that you do not know me, but you are the headmaster of my American friend Gabriella.
As you already saw in the subject, I am writing to you, because I think that the novel The Hate U Give should not be banned from any shcool library worldwide.
I read the book and we talked about it in school so I can have an opinion on that.
I can notcannot understand why I should be banned.
Because it contains offensive language?
But then why is it fine to read To kill a Mockingbird, which contains the N-word?
It is written from a black woman and the protagonist is also a 16 year old black girl.
What should be offensive?
And it is normal that teenagers use vulgar language.
They use it in their freetime and when speaking to their friends.
Why should it be a problem in a book?
To say that the book encourages teenagers to use drugs is in my opinion wrong.
I think especially in the end the novel underlines that drug dealing and being a gang member puts you in danger.
A good example is DeVante who wants to stop dealing drugs and who wants to leave the gang and achieves his goals with the help of Maverick, who did the same.
Also the argument that it shows negativnegative light on the police is in my opinion weak.
On the one hand the novel just shows the reality of police violence in the USA.
On the other hand in the novel it is also a cop, who does a great job.
Uncle Carlos is also a cop, but does not shoot black people.
He is a cop because he wants to protect his family.
That is why not all cops are showedshown in negative light.
Racial injustice is a very important topic worldwide.
This book helps to enlighten students and make them more aware of their behaviour.
When we ban it everywhere thanthen I do not know how we should learn about discrimination.
When we do not learn about it the big difference between black and white whill not get smaller but bigger.
I hope I was able to convince you on my opinion and that you think about my questions.
